newsitem.title: POLAND: Volvo opens bus plant in Poland.
newsitem.headline: Volvo opens bus plant in Poland.

text.p: Sweden's Volvo opened a bus factory in Poland on Tuesday to produce about 250 vehicles annually, PAP news agency reported.

"Entering the Polish market we start with the production of buses. But in the future we plan to produce Volvo's other models," PAP quoted Heimo Ylenius, director general of the Volvo Bus Poland, as saying at the opening ceremony.
The factory, based in the south-western city of Wroclaw, employs 200 people and will assemble 28 buses in 1996. Its annual output target is 250 vehicles.
The plant will produce bus bodies but will import most techonologically advanced components from Sweden, PAP quoted factory's sales official Tymoteusz Skroban as saying.

The New Financial Stabilisation Fund, an investment fund set up under a government scheme to clear up the bad loan mess at failed mortgage firms seems to have bought about 15 billion yen worth of the new 10-year JGBs, the trader said.
"They seem to be investing much of their funds in short-term instruments, however. I heard that the fund invited offers to buy Treasury Bills yesterday morning," he said.
A brokerage trader said traders will be watching a regular news conference by Yasuo Matsushita, the Bank of Japan governor, due at 3 p.m. (0600 GMT).
